definition: to seek/to look for/to request/to demand/to beseech

sentences.english: The demons begged Jesus to let them go into them, and he gave them permission.
sentences.chinese: 鬼央求耶稣，准他们进入猪里去。

sentences.english: In Chapter IX of the novel, Catherine implored Nelly to listen to her presentation of her dreamland.
sentences.chinese: 在小说第九章，凯瑟琳央求耐莉听她讲述自己的梦境。

sentences.english: She loved to hear me, often switching off the radio to beg me to sing it one more time.
sentences.chinese: 她喜欢听我唱歌，常常关掉收录机，央求我再唱一遍。

sentences.english: The children beg her sometimes to move back to New York.
sentences.chinese: 有时孩子们会央求她搬回纽约去。

sentences.english: Female thief beg, beg you to must not call the police, how do you go.
sentences.chinese: 女贼央求道，求求你千万别报警，你怎样都行。

sentences.english: The flower is your for the asking.
sentences.chinese: 只要你央求，那朵花就是你的。

sentences.english: He often asks me to sing a song.
The United Sthpublishings to get rid of the eye golf bag oper requirements.
sentences.chinese: 美者举行去眼袋手术的央求。

sentences.english: They ced for more time to repay the loper.
sentences.chinese: 他们央求有更多的时间来了偿存款。

sentences.english: The people ask for political asylum.
Players control Darwin, the G-Force team leader, and housefly surveillance commando Mooch .
sentences.chinese: 玩家控制达尔文，G力组长，监察突击队央求家蝇。

sentences.english: Fan Chin's mother had to ask one of the neighbours to go to the market to get Fan Chin.
sentences.chinese: 范母莫奈何只得央求一个邻居去集上寻范进。

sentences.english: Wead like you to consider our request once yet again.
sentences.chinese: 我们希望贵方再次酌量我们的央求。

sentences.english: If you wish knowledge:you must toil for it.
sentences.chinese: 若央求条件知识，须从勤苦得。

sentences.english: The child, with tears in his eyes, implored his father not to be angry.
sentences.chinese: 这孩子眼里含着泪，央求他的父亲不要生气。

definition: can't persuade/unable to make (sb) change their mind/unable to resist (sb)
to beg for mercy/to ask for forgiveness
to coax and pester (idiom)/to wheedle/to cajole
to try one's very best to persuade sb (idiom)/to reason with sb in every way possible
to cajole/to sweet talk sb into doing sth
to advise/to urge/to try to persuade/to exhort/to console/to soothe
